Package org.apache.calcite.avatica.server

Interface AvaticaServerConfiguration

public interface AvaticaServerConfiguration
A generic configuration interface that users can implement to configure the HttpServer.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> T
    doAsRemoteUser(String remoteUserName, String remoteAddress, Callable<T> action)
    Invokes the given action as the remoteUserName.
    String[]
    getAllowedRoles()
    Returns the array of allowed roles for login.

    getAuthenticationType()
    Returns the type of authentication the HttpServer should use.

    getHashLoginServiceProperties()
    Returns the path to a properties file that contains users and realms.
    String
    getHashLoginServiceRealm()
    Returns the name of the realm to use in coordination with the properties files specified by getHashLoginServiceProperties().

    Returns the "instance" component of the Kerberos principal for the Avatica server, e.g.

  • Method Details

    • getAuthenticationType

      AuthenticationType getAuthenticationType()
      Returns the type of authentication the HttpServer should use.
      Returns:
      An enum corresponding to an authentication mechanism

    • getKerberosRealm

      String getKerberosRealm()
      Returns the Kerberos realm to use for the server's login. Only relevant when getAuthenticationType() returns AuthenticationType.SPNEGO.
      Returns:
      The Kerberos realm for the server login, or null if not applicable.

    • getKerberosServiceName

      String getKerberosServiceName()
      Returns the "primary" component of the Kerberos principal for the Avatica server, e.g. primary/instance@REALM

    • getKerberosHostName

      String getKerberosHostName()
      Returns the "instance" component of the Kerberos principal for the Avatica server, e.g. primary/instance@REALM

    • getKerberosPrincipal

      String getKerberosPrincipal()
      Returns the Kerberos principal that the Avatica server should log in as.
      Returns:
      A Kerberos principal, or null if not applicable.

    • getKerberosKeytab

      default File getKerberosKeytab()
      Returns the file to the server's Kerberos keytab.

    • getAllowedRoles

      String[] getAllowedRoles()
      Returns the array of allowed roles for login. Only applicable when getAuthenticationType() returns AuthenticationType.BASIC or AuthenticationType.DIGEST.
      Returns:
      An array of allowed login roles, or null.

    • getHashLoginServiceRealm

      String getHashLoginServiceRealm()
      Returns the name of the realm to use in coordination with the properties files specified by getHashLoginServiceProperties(). Only applicable when getAuthenticationType() returns AuthenticationType.BASIC or AuthenticationType.DIGEST.
      Returns:
      A realm for the HashLoginService, or null.

    • getHashLoginServiceProperties

      String getHashLoginServiceProperties()
      Returns the path to a properties file that contains users and realms. Only applicable when getAuthenticationType() returns AuthenticationType.BASIC or AuthenticationType.DIGEST.
      Returns:
      A realm for the HashLoginService, or null.

    • supportsImpersonation

      boolean supportsImpersonation()
      Returns true if the Avatica server should run user requests at that remote user. Otherwise, all requests are run as the Avatica server user (which is the default).
      Returns:
      True if impersonation is enabled, false otherwise.

    • doAsRemoteUser

      <T> T doAsRemoteUser(String remoteUserName, String remoteAddress, Callable<T> action) throws Exception
      Invokes the given action as the remoteUserName. This will only be invoked if supportsImpersonation() returns true.
      Parameters:
      remoteUserName - The remote user making a request to the Avatica server.
      remoteAddress - The address the remote user is making the request from.
      Returns:
      The result from the Callable.
      Throws:
      Exception
      See Also:
      • to deny a remoteUser access

    • getRemoteUserExtractor

      RemoteUserExtractor getRemoteUserExtractor()
      Extract the user this request should execute as.
      Returns:
      Name of the RemoteUserExtractor
